melting.ionCorrection.sodiumEquivalence
Class SodiumEquivalent

java.lang.Object
  melting.ionCorrection.sodiumEquivalence.SodiumEquivalent
All Implemented Interfaces:
SodiumEquivalentMethod
Direct Known Subclasses:
Ahsen01_NaEquivalent, Mitsuhashi96NaEquivalent, Peyret00_NaEquivalent
public abstract class SodiumEquivalent
extends java.lang.Object
implements SodiumEquivalentMethod

This class represents the methods to compute a sodium equivalence. It implements the SodiumEquivalentMethod interface.

Method Detail

isApplicable

public boolean isApplicable(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> options)
Description copied from interface: SodiumEquivalentMethod
Check if the model to compute an equivalent sodium cencentration is applicable with the options entered by the user.

Specified by:
isApplicable in interface SodiumEquivalentMethod
Returns:
false if one of the options entered by the user make the model inapplicable. If one of the options can make the results less reliable, a warning message will appear.

getSodiumEquivalent

public double getSodiumEquivalent(double Na,
                                  double Mg,
                                  double K,
                                  double Tris,
                                  double dNTP,
                                  double b)
This method is called to get a sodium equivalent concentration when other cations are present.

Parameters:
double - Na : sodium concentration
double - Mg : magnesium concentration
double - K : potassium concentration
double - Tris : Tris buffer concentration
double - dNTP : dNTP concentration
double - b : a formula parameter depending on the model.
Returns:
double NaEq : the sodium equivalent concentration which takes in account the other cation concentrations.
